chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edwin Rivas Jr.

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Defendant Edwin Rivas Jr. in court.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Edwin Rivas Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Duren received and waives formal reading of Information.  Atty Duren stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Pleas.  Atty Duren requests pre-trial and telephone status.  Matter reset.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on February 2, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:15 AM Defendant Edwin Rivas Jr. in court.  Attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for State of Wisconsin with court officer, Hall.  DE advises he is now employed and has been trying to reach out to find local counsel and hasn't been able to do so.  DE wishes to have counsel.  State wishes to proceed today as this is the second time the officer has been here.  Court proceeds.  State calls Officer, J. Hall - S&T.  Witness identifies DE.  Record reflects same.  DE cross exams. No re-direct.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.   Court appoints Attorney Blake Duren, 158 E. Main Street, Reedsburg, WI 53959 (608) 415-9066 @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $50.00/month commencing October 1, 2022, directly to the Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
Arraignment scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:48 AM Defendant Edwin Rivas Jr. in court.  Attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for State of Wisconsin and Officer, J. Hall.  DE advises he is no longer working and was denied PD representation due to his income.  Requests court appointed counsel.  DE has not talked to the PD's office since he is now unemployed.  Recess at 10:50 a.m. to allow DE to contact PD's office.  Back on the record at 10:53 AM.  Appearances remain the same minus Office Hall.  DE needs to provide verification to the PD's office that he no longer is employed.  Matter reset.  DE to advise Court if he does not qualify for public defender representation to get an IH scheduled.  DE confirms address.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edwin Rivas Jr. appeared by video from LEC, in custody.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger appeared by video for Edwin Rivas Jr.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Atty Getsinger advises DE did contact the public defender's office but does plan to seek private counsel.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $500 cash bond.  Atty Getsinger recommends a signature bond or no more than $250 cash bond.  $2,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.
